thread.title: Texas freshman apologizes for in-game retweet
thread.title_full: Texas freshman apologizes for in-game retweet

author: USA TODAY Sports, USA TODAY
title: Texas freshman apologizes for in-game retweet
text:
Texas freshman apologizes for in-game retweet USA Today Sports 3 hrs ago by USA TODAY Sports, USA TODAY © Erich Schlegel, USA TODAY Sports Erich Schlegel, USA TODAY Sports Texas freshman Kris Boyd apologized Sunday for making head coach Charlie Strong's Saturday even worse than it already was. The Longhorns, after all, got thumped by TCU 50-7.
AdChoices Boyd caused a stir when, at halftime, he retweeted a Texas A&M fan suggesting that he transfer to the Aggies.
Strong said after the game he was not aware of Boyd's action.
“Our players should never be on their phone at halftime,” Strong said. “I was not aware of that. They should never be on their phone.”
In a statement released by Texas, Boyd tried to make amends.
"In NO way did I intend to be disrespectful or disloyal," Boyd said. "I deeply regret my actions and want to assure everyone that I am 100% committed to this team and program."
